    "changes": 36,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-audit-trail-results.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-audit-trail-results.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-audit-trail-results.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,36 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Generate an on-demand report from a query in the Audit dashboard in Permissions Management\n-description: How to generate an on-demand report from a query in the **Audit** dashboard in Permissions Management.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-# Generate an on-demand report from a query\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-This article describes how you can generate an on-demand report from a query in the **Audit** dashboard in Permissions Management. You can:\n-\n-- Run a report on-demand.\n-- Schedule and run a report as often as you want.\n-- Share a report with other members of your team and management.\n-\n-## Generate a custom report on-demand\n-\n-1. In the Permissions Management home page, select the **Audit** tab.\n-\n-    Permissions Management displays the query options available to you.\n-1. In the **Audit** dashboard, select **Search** to run the query.\n-1. Select **Export**.\n-\n-    Permissions Management generates the report and exports it in comma-separated values (**CSV**) format, portable document format (**PDF**), or Microsoft Excel Open XML Spreadsheet (**XLSX**) format.\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- For information on how to view system reports, see [Generate and view a system report in Permissions Management](report-view-system-report.md)"
  },
  {
    "sha": "26fd4150795e35ee187a3f0cac0772d0de01675d",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/how-to-clone-role-policy.md",
    "status": "removed",
    "additions": 0,
    "deletions": 44,
    "changes": 44,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-clone-role-policy.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-clone-role-policy.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-clone-role-policy.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,44 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Clone a role/policy in the Remediation dashboard in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management\n-description: How to clone a role/policy in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-# Clone a role/policy in the Remediation dashboard\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-This article describes how you can use the **Remediation** dashboard in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management to clone roles/policies for the Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, or Google Cloud Platform (GCP) authorization systems.\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> To view the **Remediation** tab, you must have **Viewer**, **Controller**, or **Administrator** permissions. To make changes on this tab, you must have **Controller** or **Administrator** permissions. If you don't have these permissions, contact your system administrator.\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Microsoft Azure uses the term *role* for what other Cloud providers call *policy*. Permissions Management automatically makes this terminology change when you select the authorization system type. In the user documentation, we use *role/policy* to refer to both.\n-\n-## Clone a role/policy\n-\n-1. On the Permissions Management home page, select the **Remediation** tab, and then select the **Role/Policies** tab.\n-1. Select the role/policy you want to clone, and from the **Actions** column, select **Clone**.\n-1. **(AWS Only)** In the **Clone** box, the **Clone Resources** and **Clone Conditions** checkboxes are automatically selected.\n-    Deselect the boxes if the resources and conditions are different from what is displayed.\n-1. Enter a name for each authorization system that was selected in the **Policy Name** boxes, and then select **Next**.\n-1. If the data collector hasn't been given controller privileges, the following message displays: **Only online/controller-enabled authorization systems can be submitted for cloning.**\n-\n-   To clone this role manually, download the script and JSON file.\n-\n-1. Select **Submit**.\n-1. Refresh the **Role/Policies** tab to see the role/policy you cloned.\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-\n-- To view existing roles/policies, requests, and permissions, see [View roles/policies, requests, and permission in the Remediation dashboard](ui-remediation.md).\n-- To view information about roles/policies, see [View information about roles/policies](how-to-view-role-policy.md)"
  },
  {
    "sha": "de20de1f1e9341d31849d7401b00682cfa4dc914",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/how-to-configure-aws-iam.md",
    "status": "removed",
    "additions": 0,
    "deletions": 64,
    "changes": 64,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-configure-aws-iam.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-configure-aws-iam.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-configure-aws-iam.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,64 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Configure AWS IAM Identity Center as an identity provider\n-description: How to configure AWS IAM Identity Center as an identity provider.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-# Configure AWS IAM Identity Center as an identity provider (preview)\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-If you're an Amazon Web Services (AWS) customer who uses the AWS IAM Identity Center, you can configure the Identity Center as an identity provider in Permissions Management. Configuring your AWS IAM Identity Center information allows you to receive more accurate data for your identities in Permissions Management.\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Configuring AWS IAM Identity Center as an identity provider is an optional step. By configuring identity provider information, Permissions Management can read user and role access configured at AWS IAM Identity Center. Admins can see the augmented view of assigned permissions to the identities. You can return to these steps to configure an IdP at any time.\n-\n-## How to configure AWS IAM Identity Center as an identity provider\n-\n-1. If the **Data Collectors** dashboard isn't displayed when Permissions Management launches, select **Settings** (gear icon), and then select the **Data Collectors** subtab. \n-\n-\n-2. On the **Data Collectors** dashboard, select **AWS**, and then select **Create Configuration**. If a Data Collector already exists in your AWS account and you want to add AWS IAM integration, then: \n-    - Select the Data Collector for which you want to configure AWS IAM. \n-    - Click on the ellipsis next to the **Authorization Systems Status**. \n-    - Select **Integrate Identity Provider**. \n-\n-3. On the **Integrate Identity provider (IdP)** page, select the box for **AWS IAM Identity Center**. \n-\n-4. Fill in the following fields:\n-    - The **AWS IAM Identity Center Region**. Specify the region where AWS IAM Identity Center is installed. All data configured in the IAM Identity Center  \n-    is stored in the Region where the IAM Identity Center is installed.   \n-    - Your **AWS Management Account ID**\n-    - Your **AWS Management Account Role**\n-\n-5. Select **Launch Management Account Template**. The template opens in a new window. \n-6. If the Management Account stack is created with the CloudFormation Template as part of the previous onboarding steps, update the stack by running ``EnableSSO`` as true. Running this command creates a new stack when running the Management Account Template. \n-\n-The template execution attaches the AWS managed policy  ``AWSSSOReadOnly`` and the newly created custom policy ``SSOPolicy`` to the AWS IAM role that allows Microsoft Entra Permissions Management to collect organizational information. The following details are requested in the template. All fields are prepopulated, and you can edit the data as you need: \n-- **Stack name** – The Stack name is the name of the AWS stack for creating the required AWS resources for Permissions Management to collect organizational information. The default value is ``mciem-org-<tenant-id>``. \n-\n-- **CFT Parameters**\n-    - **OIDC Provider Role Name** – Name of the IAM Role OIDC Provider that can assume the role. The default value is the OIDC account role (as entered in Permissions Management).\n-\n-    - **Org Account Role Name** - Name of the IAM Role. The default value is prepopulated with the Management account role name (as entered in Microsoft Entra PM).\n-\n-    - **true** – Enables AWS SSO. The default value is ``true`` when the template is launched from the Configure Identity Provider (IdP) page, otherwise the default is ``false``. \n-\n-    - **OIDC Provider Account ID** – The Account ID where the OIDC Provider is created. The default value is the OIDC Provider Account ID (as entered in Permissions Management). \n-\n-    - **Tenant ID** – ID of the tenant where the application is created. The default value is ``tenant-id`` (the configured tenant). \n-7. Click **Next** to review and confirm the information you've entered.\n-\n-8. Click **Verify Now & Save**.\n-\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- For information on how to attach and detach permissions AWS identities, see [Attach and detach policies for AWS identities](how-to-attach-detach-permissions.md)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "37c2b319176b954631b614e91dbf6392656cb479",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/how-to-configure-okta-as-an-identity-provider.md",
    "status": "removed",
    "additions": 0,
    "deletions": 111,
    "changes": 111,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-configure-okta-as-an-identity-provider.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-configure-okta-as-an-identity-provider.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-configure-okta-as-an-identity-provider.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,111 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Configure Okta as an identity provider\n-description: How to configure Okta as an identity provider in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-# Configure Okta as an identity provider (preview)\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-This article describes how to integrate Okta as an identity provider (IdP) for an Amazon Web Services (AWS) account in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management. \n-\n-Permissions Required:\n-\n-\n-| **Account**                  | **Permissions Required**                                         |**Why?**                   |\n-|-----------------------|-----------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------|\n-| Permissions Management   | Permissions Management Administrator     | Admin can create and edit the AWS authorization system onboarding configuration.   | \n-| Okta                 | API Access Management Administrator     | Admin can add the application in the Okta portal and add or edit the API scope.    |\n-| AWS   | AWS permissions explicitly     |  Admin should be able to run the cloudformation stack to create  1. AWS Secret in Secrets Manager; 2. Managed policy to allow the role to read the AWS secret. | \n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> While configuring the Amazon Web Services (AWS) app in Okta, the suggested AWS role group syntax is (```aws#{account alias]#{role name}#{account #]```).\n-> Sample RegEx pattern for the group filter name are:\n-> - ```^aws\\#\\S+\\#?{{role}}[\\w\\-]+)\\#(?{{accountid}}\\d+)$```\n-> - ```aws_(?{{accountid}}\\d+)_(?{{role}}[a-zA-Z0-9+=,.@\\-_]+)```\n-> Permissions Management reads default suggested filters. Custom RegEx expression for group syntax is not supported.\n-\n-## How to configure Okta as an identity provider\n-\n-1. Log in to the Okta portal with API Access Management Administrator. \n-2. Create a new **Okta API Services Application**. \n-3. In the Admin Console, go to Applications. \n-4. On the Create a new app integration page, select **API Services**.\n-5. Enter a name for your app integration and click **Save**. \n-6. Copy the **Client ID** for future use.  \n-7. In the **Client Credentials** section of the General tab, click **Edit** to change the client authentication method. \n-8. Select **Public key/Private key** as the Client authentication method. \n-9. Leave the default **Save keys in Okta**, then click **Add key**. \n-10. Click **Add** and in the **Add a public key** dialog, either paste your own public key or click **Generate new key** to autogenerate a new 2048-bit RSA key. \n-11. Copy **Public Key Id** for future use.  \n-12. Click **Generate new key** and the public and private keys appear in JWK format. \n-13. Click **PEM**. The private key appears in PEM format. \n-    This is your only opportunity to save the private key. Click **Copy to clipboard** to copy the private key and store it somewhere safe. \n-14. Click **Done**. The new public key is now registered with the app and appears in a table in the **PUBLIC KEYS** section of the **General** tab. \n-15. From the Okta API scopes tab, grant these scopes:\n-    - okta.users.read\n-    - okta.groups.read\n-    - okta.apps.read\n-16. Optional. Click the **Application rate limits** tab to adjust the rate-limit capacity percentage for this service application. By default, each new application sets this percentage at 50 percent. \n-\n-### Convert public key to a Base64 string\n-\n-1. See instructions for [using a personal access token (PAT)](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2249174).\n-\n-### Find your Okta URL (also called an Okta domain)\n-\n-This Okta URL/Okta domain is saved in the AWS secret.\n-\n-1. Sign in to your Okta organization with your administrator account.\n-2. Look for the Okta URL/Okta domain in the global header of the dashboard. \n-Once located, note the Okta URL in an app such as Notepad. You'll need this URL for your next steps. \n-\n-### Configure AWS stack details\n-\n-1. Fill in the following fields on the **CloudFormation Template Specify stack details** screen using the information from your Okta application:\n-    - **Stack name** - A name of our choosing\n-    - **Or URL** Your organization's Okta URL, example: *https://companyname.okta.com*\n-    - **Client Id** - From the **Client Credentials** section of your Okta application\n-    - **Public Key Id** - Click **Add > Generate new key**. The public key is generated \n-    - **Private Key (in PEM format)** - Base64 encoded string of the PEM format of the **Private key**\n-     > [!NOTE]\n-     > You must copy all text in the field before converting to a Base64 string, including the dash before BEGIN PRIVATE KEY and after END PRIVATE KEY.\n-2. When the **CloudFormation Template Specify stack details** screen is complete, click **Next**.\n-3. On the **Configure stack options** screen, click **Next**.\n-4. Review the information you've entered, then click **Submit**.\n-5. Select the **Resources** tab, then copy the **Physical ID** (this ID is the Secret ARN) for future use.\n-\n-### Configure Okta in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Integrating Okta as an identity provider is an optional step. You can return to these steps to configure an IdP at any time. \n-\n-1. If the **Data Collectors** dashboard isn't displayed when Permissions Management launches, select **Settings** (gear icon), and then select the **Data Collectors** subtab.\n-2. On the **Data Collectors** dashboard, select **AWS**, and then select **Create Configuration**.\n-    Complete the **Manage Authorization System** steps.\n-    > [!NOTE]\n-    > If a Data Collector already exists in your AWS account and you want to add Okta integration, follow these steps:\n-    >  1. Select the Data Collector for which you want to add Okta integration.\n-    >  1. Click on the ellipsis next to the **Authorization System Status**.\n-    >  1. Select **Integrate Identity Provider**.\n-\n-3. On the **Integrate Identity Provider (IdP)** page, select the box for **Okta**.\n-4. Select **Launch CloudFormation Template**. The template opens in a new window.\n-   > [!NOTE]\n-   > Here you'll fill in information to create a secret Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that you'll enter on the **Integrate Identity Provider (IdP)** page. Microsoft does not read or store this ARN.\n-5. Return to the Permissions Management **Integrate Identity Provider (IdP)** page and paste the **Secret ARN** in the field provided.\n-6. Click **Next** to review and confirm the information you've entered.\n-7. Click **Verify Now & Save**.\n-   The system returns the populated AWS CloudFormation Template. \n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- For information on how to view existing roles/policies, requests, and permissions, see [View roles/policies, requests, and permission in the Remediation dashboard](ui-remediation.md)."
  },

    "sha": "92fa931761eb202a1b4a51c1b2936a8fa0e154b4",

    "status": "removed",

    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-configure-servicenow-application.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-configure-servicenow-application.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-configure-servicenow-application.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,62 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Configure the ServiceNow application with Permissions Management\n-description: How to configure ServiceNow with Microsoft Entra Permissions Management.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n-ms.custom: sfi-image-nochange\n----\n-\n-# Configure the ServiceNow app for Microsoft Entra Permissions Management\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-Manage your multicloud permissions by integrating ServiceNow with Microsoft Entra Permissions Management. \n-\n-Permissions Management integrates with ServiceNow to simplify Permissions on Demand (POD) requests by automating the request-for-permissions workflow. Users can request, approve, revoke, and audit their permissions using automated ServiceNow workflows. Users can also view current permissions requests in a single dashboard. With this app, users can streamline Permissions Management and improve security and compliance in their organization.\n-\n-## Key features\n-\n-The ServiceNow app for Microsoft Entra Permissions Management offers the following capabilities:\n-\n-- Request, approve, and reject permissions on demand: You can request permissions for yourself or workload identities using a simple form in ServiceNow. You can also approve or reject requests from team members using ServiceNow notifications and approvals.\n-\n-:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/configure-servicenow-application/servicenow-permissions-management-dashboard.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of ServiceNow Microsoft Entra Permissions Management dashboard.\" lightbox=\"media/configure-servicenow-application/servicenow-permissions-management-dashboard.png\":::\n-\n-- Audit permissions requests and limit access to users/groups: You can view and track your permissions and access requests in a dashboard in ServiceNow and generate reports and audit logs to monitor and verify your permissions and compliance. \n-\n-:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/configure-servicenow-application/servicenow-portal.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of ServiceNow Microsoft Entra Permissions Management portal.\" lightbox=\"media/configure-servicenow-application/servicenow-portal.png\":::\n-\n-- Configure Manage users and groups by assigning them access only to specific authorization systems, policies, and roles.\n-\n-- Notify users when their privileges are assigned or revoked: You can send notifications to users when they have new permissions assignments, or if current permissions are modified.\n-\n-\n-## How to configure ServiceNow with Microsoft Entra Permissions Management\n-\n-To proceed with these steps, make sure these permissions are available and configured in your environment for the configuration process.\n-\n-### Prerequisites\n-\n-- Access to Microsoft Entra Permissions Management as a Permissions Management Administrator\n-- Microsoft Entra admin who can create Applications\n-- ServiceNow admin\n-\n-To integration the ServiceNow app with Microsoft Entra Permissions Management:\n-\n-1.\tRegister the ServiceNow Application on Microsoft Entra ID for authentication of API calls. \n-2.\tAssign the permissions Viewer and Approver for all in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management to the service principal, under **User Management**. \n-3.\tGet the [ServiceNow app for Microsoft Entra Permissions Management](https://store.servicenow.com/sn_appstore_store.do#!/store/application/24073ae31bfca9100e564082b24bcb56/1.1.0) from the ServiceNow store.\n-4.\tSelect the app, then click **Install**. \n-The installation process begins and the application is installed in your instance.\n-5. Configure the app by following the instructions.\n-:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/configure-servicenow-application/servicenow-microsoft-entra-permissions-management-installation.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of ServiceNow Microsoft Entra Permissions Management installation.\" lightbox=\"media/configure-servicenow-application/servicenow-microsoft-entra-permissions-management-installation.png\":::\n-\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- For information on creating users, understanding use cases, and troubleshooting, see [Microsoft Entra Permissions Management ServiceNow Integration and Configuration Guide](https://store.servicenow.com/appStoreAttachments.do?sys_id=2f17e5841bbd3d50e0190d48624bcb2c)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "c3309e796fe1a2f4250aecde87732c301e8296e0",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/how-to-create-alert-trigger.md",
    "status": "removed",
    "additions": 0,
    "deletions": 108,
    "changes": 108,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-create-alert-trigger.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-create-alert-trigger.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-create-alert-trigger.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,108 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Create and view activity alerts and alert triggers in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management\n-description: How to create and view activity alerts and alert triggers in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-# Create and view activity alerts and alert triggers\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-This article describes how to create and view activity alerts and alert triggers in Permissions Management.\n-\n-## Create an activity alert trigger\n-\n-1. In the Permissions Management home page, select **Activity Triggers** (the bell icon).\n-1. In the **Activity** tab, select **Create Activity Trigger**.\n-1. In the **Alert Name** box, enter a name for your alert.\n-1. In **Authorization System Type**, select your authorization system: Amazon Web Services (**AWS**), Microsoft **Azure**, or Google Cloud Platform (**GCP**).\n-1. In **Authorization System**, select **Is** or **In**, and then select one or more accounts and folders.\n-1. From the **Select a Type** dropdown, select: **Access Key ID**, **Identity Tag Key**, **Identity Tag Key Value**, **Resource Name**, **Resource Tag Key**,  **Resource Tag Key Value**, **Role Name**, **Role Session Name**, **State**, **Task Name**, or **Username**.\n-1. From the **Operator** dropdown, select an option:\n-\n-    - **Is**/**Is Not**: Select in the value field to view a list of all available values. You can either select or enter the required value.\n-    - **Contains**/**Not Contains**: Enter any text that the query parameter should or shouldn't contain, for example *Permissions Management*.\n-    - **In**/**Not In**: Select in the value field to view list of all available values. Select the required multiple values.\n-\n-1. To add another parameter, select the plus sign **(+)**, then select an operator, and then enter a value.\n-1. To remove a parameter, select the minus sign **(-)**.\n-1. To add another activity type, select **Add**, and then enter your parameters.\n-1. To save your alert, select **Save**.\n-\n-    A message displays to confirm your activity trigger has been created.\n-\n-    The **Triggers** table in the **Alert Triggers** subtab displays your alert trigger.\n-\n-## View an activity alert\n-\n-1. In the Permissions Management home page, select **Activity Triggers** (the bell icon).\n-1. In the **Activity** tab, select the **Alerts** subtab.\n-1. From the **Alert Name** dropdown, select an alert.\n-1. From the **Date** dropdown, select **Last 24 Hours**, **Last 2 Days**, **Last Week**, or **Custom Range**.\n-\n-    If you select **Custom Range**, select date and time settings, and then select **Apply**.\n-1. To view the alert, select **Apply**\n-\n-    The **Alerts** table displays information about your alert.\n-\n-    Select the alert name to view the individual activities and further details about the **resources**, **tasks**, and **identities** involved.\n-\n-\n-## View activity alert triggers\n-\n-1. In the Permissions Management home page, select **Activity triggers** (the bell icon).\n-1. In the **Activity** tab, select the **Alert Triggers** subtab.\n-1. From the **Status** dropdown, select **All**, **Activated** or **Deactivated**, then select **Apply**.\n-\n-    The **Triggers** table displays the following information:\n-\n-    - **Alerts**: The name of the alert trigger.\n-    - **# of users subscribed**: The number of users who have subscribed to a specific alert trigger.\n-\n-        - Select a number in this column to view information about the user.\n-\n-    - **Created By**: The email address of the user who created the alert trigger.\n-    - **Modified By**: The email address of the user who last modified the alert trigger.\n-    - **Last Updated**: The date and time the alert trigger was last updated.\n-    - **Subscription**: A switch that displays if the alert is **On** or **Off**.\n-\n-         - If the column displays **Off**, the current user isn't subscribed to that alert. Switch the toggle to **On** to subscribe to the alert.\n-         - The user who creates an alert trigger is automatically subscribed to the alert, and receives emails about the alert.\n-\n-1. To see only activated or only deactivated triggers, from the **Status** dropdown, select **Activated** or **Deactivated**, and then select **Apply**.\n-\n-1. To view other options available to you, select the ellipses (**...**), and then select from the available options.\n-\n-    If the **Subscription** is **On**, the following options are available:\n-\n-    - **Edit**: Enables you to modify alert parameters\n-\n-       > [!NOTE]\n-         > Only the user who created the alert can perform the following actions: edit the trigger screen, rename an alert, deactivate an alert, and delete an alert. Changes made by other users aren't saved.\n-\n-    - **Duplicate**: Create a duplicate of the alert called \"**Copy of XXX**\".\n-    - **Rename**: Enter the new name of the query, and then select **Save.**\n-    - **Deactivate**: The alert is listed, but no longer sends emails to subscribed users.\n-    - **Activate**: Activate the alert trigger and start sending emails to subscribed users.\n-    - **Notification Settings**: View the **Email** of users who are subscribed to the alert trigger and their **User Status**.\n-    - **Delete**: Delete the alert.\n-\n-    If the **Subscription** is **Off**, the following options are available:\n-    - **View**: View  details of the alert trigger.\n-    - **Notification Settings**: View the **Email** of users who are subscribed to the alert trigger and their **User Status**.\n-    - **Duplicate**: Create a duplicate copy of the selected alert trigger.\n-\n-\n-\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- For an overview on activity triggers, see [View information about activity triggers](ui-triggers.md).\n-- For information on rule-based anomalies and anomaly triggers, see [Create and view rule-based anomalies and anomaly triggers](product-rule-based-anomalies.md)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "4e92fae06179edc5320b55b417054519f0e33b4a",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/how-to-create-approve-privilege-request.md",
    "status": "removed",
    "additions": 0,
    "deletions": 121,
    "changes": 121,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-create-approve-privilege-request.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-create-approve-privilege-request.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-create-approve-privilege-request.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,121 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Create or approve a request for permissions in the Remediation dashboard\n-description: How to create or approve a request for permissions in the Remediation dashboard.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-# Create or approve a request for permissions\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-This article describes how to create or approve a request for permissions in the **Remediation** dashboard in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management. You can create and approve requests for the Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, or Google Cloud Platform (GCP) authorization systems.\n-\n-The **Remediation** dashboard has two privilege-on-demand (POD) workflows you can use:\n-- **New Request**: The workflow used by a user to create a request for permissions for a specified duration.\n-- **Approver**: The workflow used by an approver to review and approve or reject a user's request for permissions.\n-\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> To view the **Remediation** dashboard, you must have **Viewer**, **Controller**, or **Administrator** permissions. To make changes on this tab, you must have **Controller** or **Administrator** permissions. If you don't have these permissions, contact your system administrator.\n-\n-## Create a request for permissions\n-\n-1. On the Permissions Management home page, select the **Remediation** tab, and then select the **My Requests** subtab.\n-\n-    The **My Requests** subtab displays the following options:\n-    - **Pending**: A list of requests you've made but haven't yet been reviewed.\n-    - **Approved**: A list of requests that have been reviewed and approved by the approver. These requests have either already been activated or are in the process of being activated.\n-    - **Processed**: A summary of the requests you've created that have been approved (**Done**), **Rejected**, and requests that have been **Canceled**.\n-\n-1. To create a request for permissions, select **New Request**.\n-1. In the **Roles/Tasks** page:\n-    1. From the **Authorization System Type** dropdown, select the authorization system type you want to access: **AWS**, **Azure** or **GCP**.\n-    1. From the **Authorization System** dropdown, select the accounts you want to access.\n-    1. From the **Identity** dropdown, select the identity on whose behalf you're requesting access.\n-\n-        - If the identity you select is a Security Assertions Markup Language (SAML) user, and since a SAML user accesses the system through assumption of a role, select the user's role in **Role**.\n-\n-        - If the identity you select is a local user, to select the policies you want:\n-            1. Select **Request Policy(s)**.\n-            1. In **Available Policies**, select the policies you want.\n-            1. To select a specific policy, select the plus sign, and then find and select the policy you want.\n-\n-            The policies you've selected appear in the **Selected policies** box.\n-\n-        - If the identity you select is a local user, to select the tasks you want:\n-            1. Select **Request Task(s)**.\n-            1. In **Available Tasks**, select the tasks you want.\n-            1. To select a specific task, select the plus sign, and then select the task you want.\n-\n-            The tasks you've selected appear in the **Selected Tasks** box.\n-\n-    If the user already has existing policies, they're displayed in **Existing Policies**.\n-1. Select **Next**.\n-\n-1. If you selected **AWS**, the **Scope** page appears.\n-\n-    1. In **Select Scope**, select:\n-        - **All Resources**\n-        - **Specific Resources**, and then select the resources you want.\n-        - **No Resources**\n-    1. In **Request Conditions**:\n-        1. Select **JSON** to add a JSON block of code.\n-        1. Select **Done** to accept the code you've entered, or **Clear** to delete what you've entered and start again.\n-    1. In **Effect**, select **Allow** or **Deny.**\n-    1. Select **Next**.\n-\n-1. The **Confirmation** page appears.\n-1. In **Request Summary**, enter a summary for your request.\n-1. Optional: In **Note**, enter a note for the approver.\n-1. In **Schedule**, select when (how quickly) you want your request to be processed:\n-    - **ASAP**\n-    - **Once**\n-        - In **Create Schedule**, select the **Frequency**, **Date**, **Time**, and **For** the required duration, then select **Schedule**.\n-    - **Daily**\n-    - **Weekly**\n-    - **Monthly**\n-1. Select **Submit**.\n-\n-    The following message appears: **Your Request Has Been Successfully Submitted.**\n-\n-    The request you submitted is now listed in **Pending Requests**.\n-\n-\n-## Following are the time limits per frequency type while creating the request.\n-\n-| Frequency Type                | Time Limit (in hours)                |\n-|----------------------------|-----------------------------------|\n-|ASAP                        |    24                  |\n-|Once                        |    2160                |\n-|Daily                        |    23                  |\n-|Weekly                        |    23                |\n-|Monthly                    |    672                    |\n-\n-## Approve or reject a request for permissions\n-\n-1. On the Permissions Management home page, select the **Remediation** tab, and then select the **My requests** subtab.\n-1. To view a list of requests that haven't yet been reviewed, select **Pending Requests**.\n-1. In the **Request Summary** list, select the ellipses **(…)** menu on the right of a request, and then select:\n-\n-    - **Details** to view the details of the request.\n-    - **Approve** to approve the request.\n-    - **Reject** to reject the request.\n-\n-1. (Optional) add a note to the requestor, and then select **Confirm.**\n-\n-    The **Approved** subtab displays a list of requests that have been reviewed and approved by the approver. These requests have either already been activated or are in the process of being activated.\n-    The **Processed** subtab displays a summary of the requests that have been approved or rejected, and requests that have been canceled.\n-\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- For information on how to attach and detach permissions for Amazon Web Services (AWS) identities, see [Attach and detach policies for AWS identities](how-to-attach-detach-permissions.md).\n-- For information on how to add and remove roles and tasks for Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform (GCP) identities, see [Add and remove roles and tasks for Azure and GCP identities](how-to-attach-detach-permissions.md).\n-- For information on how to revoke high-risk and unused tasks or assign read-only status for Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform (GCP) identities, see [Revoke high-risk and unused tasks or assign read-only status for Azure and GCP identities](how-to-revoke-task-readonly-status.md)"
  },
  {
    "sha": "da488b2f4664661e097f5bb034ec6dbe433cb6c2",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/how-to-create-custom-queries.md",
    "status": "removed",
    "additions": 0,
    "deletions": 116,
    "changes": 116,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-create-custom-queries.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-create-custom-queries.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-create-custom-queries.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,116 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Create a custom query in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management\n-description: How to create a custom query in the Audit dashboard in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-# Create a custom query\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-This article describes how you can use the **Audit** dashboard in Permissions Management to create custom queries that you can modify, save, and run as often as you want.\n-\n-## Open the Audit dashboard\n-\n-- In the Permissions Management home page, select the **Audit** tab.\n-\n-    Permissions Management displays the query options available to you.\n-\n-## Create a custom query\n-\n-1. In the **Audit** dashboard, in the **New Query** subtab, select **Authorization System Type**, and then select the authorization systems you want to search: Amazon Web Services (**AWS**), Microsoft **Azure**, Google Cloud Platform (**GCP**), or Platform (**Platform**).\n-1. Select the authorization systems you want to search from the **List** and **Folders** box, and then select **Apply**.\n-\n-1. In the **New Query** box, enter your query parameters, and then select **Add**.\n-    For example, to query by a date, select **Date** in the first box. In the second and third boxes, select the down arrow, and then select one of the date-related options.\n-\n-1. To add parameters, select **Add**, select the down arrow in the first box to display a dropdown of available selections. Then select the parameter you want.\n-1. To add more parameters to the same query, select **Add** (the plus sign), and from the first box, select **And** or **Or**.\n-\n-    Repeat this step for the second and third box to complete entering the parameters.\n-1. To change your query as you're creating it, select **Edit** (the pencil icon), and then change the query parameters.\n-1. To change the parameter options, select the down arrow in each box to display a dropdown of available selections. Then select the option you want.\n-1. To discard your selections, select **Reset Query** for the parameter you want to change, and then make your selections again.\n-1. When you're ready to run your query, select **Search**.\n-1. To save the query, select **Save**.\n-\n-    Permissions Management saves the query and adds it to the **Saved Queries** list.\n-\n-## Save the query under a new name\n-\n-1. In the **Audit** dashboard, select the ellipses menu **(…)** on the far right and select **Save As**.\n-2. Enter a new name for the query, and then select **Save**.\n-\n-    Permissions Management saves the query under the new name. Both the new query and the original query display in the **Saved Queries** list.\n-\n-## View a saved query\n-\n-1. In the **Audit** dashboard, select the down arrow next to **Saved Queries**.\n-\n-    A list of saved queries appears.\n-2. Select the query you want to open.\n-3. To open the query with the authorization systems you saved with the query, select **Load with the saved authorization systems**.\n-4. To open the query with the authorization systems you have currently selected (which may be different from the ones you originally saved), select **Load with the currently selected authorization systems**.\n-5. Select **Load Queries**.\n-\n-    Permissions Management displays details of the query in the **Activity** table. Select a query to see its details:\n-\n-    - The **Identity Details**.\n-    - The **Domain** name.\n-    - The **Resource Name** and **Resource Type**.\n-    - The **Task Name**.\n-    - The **Date**.\n-    - The **IP Address**.\n-    - The **Authorization System**.\n-\n-## View a raw events summary\n-\n-1. In the **Audit** dashboard, select **View** (the eye icon) to open the **Raw Events Summary** box.\n-\n-    The **Raw Events Summary** box displays **Username or Role Session Name**, the **Task name**, and the script for your query.\n-1. Select **Copy** to copy the script.\n-1. Select **X** to close the **Raw events summary** box.\n-\n-\n-## Run a saved query\n-\n-1. In the **Audit** dashboard, select the query you want to run.\n-\n-    Permissions Management displays the results of the query in the **Activity** table.\n-\n-## Delete a query\n-\n-1. In the **Audit** dashboard, load the query you want to delete.\n-2. Select **Delete**.\n-\n-    Permissions Management deletes the query. Deleted queries don't display in the **Saved Queries** list.\n-\n-## Rename a query\n-\n-1. In the **Audit** dashboard, load the query you want to rename.\n-2. Select the ellipses menu **(…)** on the far right, and select **Rename**.\n-3. Enter a new name for the query, and then select **Save**.\n-\n-    Permissions Management saves the query under the new name. Both the new query and the original query display in the **Saved Queries** list.\n-\n-## Duplicate a query\n-\n-1. In the **Audit** dashboard, load the query you want to duplicate.\n-2. Select the ellipses menu **(…)** on the far right, and then select **Duplicate**.\n-\n-    Permissions Management creates a copy of the query. Both the copy of the query and the original query display in the **Saved Queries** list.\n-\n-    You can rename the original or copy of the query, change it, and save it without changing the other query.\n-\n-\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- For information on how to generate an on-demand report from a query, see [Generate an on-demand report from a query](how-to-audit-trail-results.md)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "143109c13d670c35da0cafdf999e1555c9ecc38a",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/how-to-create-folders.md",
    "status": "removed",
    "additions": 0,
    "deletions": 32,
    "changes": 32,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-create-folders.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-create-folders.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-create-folders.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,32 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Create folders to organize your Authorization Systems\n-description: How to create folders to organize Authorization Systems - accounts, subscriptions, and projects - in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-# Create folders to organize your authorization systems\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-After onboarding your cloud environment to Permissions Management, you might have multiple authorization systems (AWS accounts, Azure subscriptions, or GCP projects) that you need to manage. You can create folders to organize and group together your list of accounts, subscriptions, or projects to manage your workflow more efficiently. \n-\n-## Create a folder\n-\n-1. On the Permissions Management home page, select the **Data Collectors** tab and make sure that the **Status** for your cloud environment is **Onboarded**.\n-1. Select the **Authorization Systems** subtab, then **Folders**.\n-1. Click **Create Folder**.\n-1. In the **Folder Name** field, enter a name for the folder you want to create.\n-1. From the list of names, select all Authorization Systems (accounts, subscriptions, or projects) you want to add to this folder.\n-1. Click **Save**. Your folder is created. \n-1. Repeat these steps to create as many folders as you need. \n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- [View data about the activity in your authorization system](product-dashboard.md)"
  },
  {
    "sha": "3b77bdf0febff11c86bf83d15322c41fb1597e6f",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/how-to-create-group-based-permissions.md",
    "status": "removed",
    "additions": 0,
    "deletions": 52,
    "changes": 52,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-create-group-based-permissions.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-create-group-based-permissions.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-create-group-based-permissions.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,52 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Select group-based permissions settings with the User management dashboard\n-description: How to select group-based permissions settings with the User management dashboard.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-# Select group-based permissions settings\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-This article describes how you can create  and manage group-based permissions in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management with the User management dashboard.\n-\n-> [!NOTE] \n-> The Permissions Management Administrator for all authorization systems will be able to create the new group based permissions.\n-\n-## Select administrative permissions settings for a group\n-\n-1. To display the **User Management** dashboard, select **User** (your initials) in the upper right of the screen, and then select **User Management**.\n-1. Select the **Groups** tab, and then press the **Create Permission** button in the upper right of the table.\n-1. In the **Set Group Permission** box, begin typing the name of a **Microsoft Entra Security Group** in your tenant.\n-\n-1. Select the permission setting you want:\n-2.\n-    - **Admin for all Authorization System Types** provides **View**, **Control**, and **Approve** permissions for all authorization system types.\n-    - **Admin for selected Authorization System Types** provides **View**, **Control**, and **Approve** permissions for selected authorization system types.\n-    - **Custom** allows you to set **View**, **Control**, and **Approve** permissions for the authorization system types that you select.\n-1. Select **Next**\n-\n-1. If you selected **Admin for all Authorization System Types**\n-    - Select Identities to add for each Authorization System. Added Identities will have access to submit requests from the **Remediation** tab.\n-\n-1. If you selected **Admin for selected Authorization System Types**\n-    - Select **Viewer**, **Controller**, or **Approver** for the **Authorization System Types** you want.\n-    - Select **Next** and then select Select Identities to add for each Authorization System. Added Identities will have access to submit requests from the **Remediation** tab.\n-\n-1. If you select **Custom**, select the **Authorization System Types** you want.\n-    - Select **Viewer**, **Controller**, or **Approver** for the **Authorization Systems** you want.\n-    - Select **Next** and then select Select Identities to add for each Authorization System. Added Identities will have access to submit requests from the **Remediation** tab.\n-\n-1. Select **Save**, The following message appears: **New Group Has been Created Successfully.**\n-1. To see the group you created in the **Groups** table, refresh the page.\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- For information about how to manage user information, see [Manage users and groups with the User management dashboard](ui-user-management.md)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "42c4c747d8e51cd948921a417212ce04e32291d9",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/how-to-create-role-policy.md",
    "status": "removed",
    "additions": 0,
    "deletions": 165,
    "changes": 165,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-create-role-policy.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-create-role-policy.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-create-role-policy.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,165 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Create a role/policy in the Remediation dashboard\n-description: How to create a role/policy in the Remediation dashboard.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-# Create a role/policy in the Remediation dashboard\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-This article describes how you can use the **Remediation** dashboard in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management to create roles/policies for the Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, or Google Cloud Platform (GCP) authorization systems.\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> To view the **Remediation** tab, you must have **Viewer**, **Controller**, or **Administrator** permissions. To make changes on this tab, you must have **Controller** or **Administrator** permissions. If you don't have these permissions, contact your system administrator.\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Microsoft Azure uses the term *role* for what other cloud providers call *policy*. Permissions Management automatically makes this terminology change when you select the authorization system type. In the user documentation, we use *role/policy* to refer to both.\n-\n-## Create a policy for AWS\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> For information on AWS service quotas, and to request an AWS service quota increase, visit [the AWS documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/aws_service_limits.html). \n-\n-1. On the Microsoft Entra home page, select the **Remediation** tab, and then select the **Role/Policies** tab.\n-1. Use the dropdown lists to select the **Authorization System Type** and **Authorization System**.\n-1. Select **Create Policy**.\n-1. On the **Details** page, the **Authorization System Type** and **Authorization System** are pre-populated from your previous settings.\n-    - To change the settings, make a selection from the dropdown.\n-1. Under **How Would You Like To Create The Policy**, select the required option:\n-\n-    - **Activity of User(s)**: Allows you to create a policy based on user activity.\n-    - **Activity of Group(s)**: Allows you to create a policy based on the aggregated activity of all the users belonging to the group(s).\n-    - **Activity of Resource(s)**: Allows you to create a policy based on the activity of a resource, for example, an EC2 instance.\n-    - **Activity of Role**: Allows you to create a policy based on the aggregated activity of all the users that assumed the role.\n-    - **Activity of Tag(s)**: Allows you to create a policy based on the aggregated activity of all the tags.\n-    - **Activity of Lambda Function**: Allows you to create a new policy based on the Lambda function.\n-    - **From Existing Policy**: Allows you to create a new policy based on an existing policy.\n-    - **New Policy**: Allows you to create a new policy from scratch.\n-1. In **Tasks performed in last**, select the duration: **90 days**, **60 days**, **30 days**, **7 days**, or **1 day**.\n-1. Depending on your preference, select or deselect **Include Access Advisor data.**\n-1. In **Settings**, from the **Available** column, select the plus sign **(+)** to move the identity into the **Selected** column, and then select **Next**.\n-\n-1. On the **Tasks** page, from the **Available** column, select the plus sign **(+)** to move the task into the **Selected** column.\n-    - To add a whole category, select a category.\n-    - To add individual items from a category, select the down arrow on the left of the category name, and then select individual items.\n-1. In **Resources**, select **All Resources** or **Specific Resources**.\n-\n-    If you select **Specific Resources**, a list of available resources appears. Find the resources you want to add, and then select **Add**.\n-1. In **Request Conditions**, select **JSON** .\n-1. In **Effect**, select **Allow** or **Deny**, and then select **Next**.\n-1. In **Policy name:**, enter a name for your policy.\n-1. To add another statement to your policy, select **Add Statement**, and then, from the list of **Statements**, select a statement.\n-1. Review your **Task**, **Resources**, **Request Conditions**, and **Effect** settings, and then select **Next**.\n-\n-\n-1. On the **Preview** page, review the script to confirm it's what you want.\n-1. If your controller isn't enabled, select **Download JSON** or **Download Script** to download the code and run it yourself.\n-\n-    If your controller is enabled, skip this step.\n-1. Select **Split Policy**, and then select **Submit**.\n-\n-    A message confirms that your policy has been submitted for creation\n-\n-1. The [**Permissions Management Tasks**](ui-tasks.md) pane appears on the right.\n-    - The **Active** tab displays a list of the policies Permissions Management is currently processing.\n-    - The **Completed** tab displays a list of the policies Permissions Management has completed.\n-1. Once data collection for the specified authorization system is complete, the newly created policy information is reflected.\n-\n-\n-\n-## Create a role for Azure\n-\n-1. On the Permissions Management home page, select the **Remediation** tab, and then select the **Role/Policies** tab.\n-1. Use the dropdown lists to select the **Authorization System Type** and **Authorization System**.\n-1. Select **Create Role**.\n-1. On the **Details** page, the **Authorization System Type** and **Authorization System** are pre-populated from your previous settings.\n-    - To change the settings, select the box and make a selection from the dropdown.\n-1. Under **How Would You Like To Create The Role?**, select the required option:\n-\n-    - **Activity of User(s)**: Allows you to create a role based on user activity.\n-    - **Activity of Group(s)**: Allows you to create a role based on the aggregated activity of all the users belonging to the group(s).\n-    - **Activity of App(s)**: Allows you to create a role based on the aggregated activity of all apps.\n-    - **From Existing Role**: Allows you to create a new role based on an existing role.\n-    - **New Role**: Allows you to create a new role from scratch.\n-\n-1. In **Tasks performed in last**, select the duration: **90 days**, **60 days**, **30 days**, **7 days**, or **1 day**.\n-1. Depending on your preference:\n-    - Select or deselect **Ignore Non-Microsoft Read Actions**.\n-    - Select or deselect **Include Read-Only Tasks**.\n-1. In **Settings**, from the **Available** column, select the plus sign **(+)** to move the identity into the **Selected** column, and then select **Next**.\n-\n-1. On the **Tasks** page, in **Role name:**, enter a name for your role.\n-1. From the **Available** column, select the plus sign **(+)** to move the task into the **Selected** column.\n-    - To add a whole category, select a category.\n-    - To add individual items from a category, select the down arrow on the left of the category name, and then select individual items.\n-1. Select **Next**.\n-1. (Optional) An Admin can copy the Resource Groups scope string to use as the scope. In Azure, select **Resource group** > **Monitoring** > **Properties**, then copy the **Resource ID**. \n-1. On the **Preview** page, review:\n-    - The list of selected **Actions** and **Not Actions**.\n-    - The **JSON** or **Script** to confirm it's what you want.\n-1. If your controller isn't enabled, select **Download JSON** or **Download Script** to download the code and run it yourself.\n-\n-    If your controller is enabled, skip this step.\n-\n-1. Select **Submit**.\n-\n-    A message confirms that your role has been submitted for creation\n-\n-1. The [**Permissions Management Tasks**](ui-tasks.md) pane appears on the right.\n-    - The **Active** tab displays a list of the policies Permissions Management is currently processing.\n-    - The **Completed** tab displays a list of the policies Permissions Management has completed.\n-1. Once data collection for the specified authorization system is complete, the newly created role information is reflected.\n-\n-## Create a role for GCP\n-\n-1. On the Permissions Management home page, select the **Remediation** tab, and then select the **Role/Policies** tab.\n-1. Use the dropdown lists to select the **Authorization System Type** and **Authorization System**.\n-1. Select **Create Role**.\n-1. On the **Details** page, the **Authorization System Type** and **Authorization System** are pre-populated from your previous settings.\n-    - To change the settings, select the box and make a selection from the dropdown.\n-1. Under **How Would You Like To Create The Role?**, select the required option:\n-\n-    - **Activity of User(s)**: Allows you to create a role based on user activity.\n-    - **Activity of Group(s)**: Allows you to create a role based on the aggregated activity of all the users belonging to the group(s).\n-    - **Activity of Service Account(s)**: Allows you to create a role based on the aggregated activity of all service accounts.\n-    - **From Existing Role**: Allows you to create a new role based on an existing role.\n-     - **New Role**: Allows you to create a new role from scratch.\n-\n-1. In **Tasks performed in last**, select the duration: **90 days**, **60 days**, **30 days**, **7 days**, or **1 day**.\n-1. If you selected **Activity Of Service Account(s)** in the previous step, select or deselect **Collect activity across all GCP Authorization Systems.**\n-1. From the **Available** column, select the plus sign **(+)** to move the identity into the **Selected** column, and then select **Next**.\n-\n-\n-1. On the **Tasks** page, in **Role name:**, enter a name for your role.\n-1. From the **Available** column, select the plus sign **(+)** to move the task into the **Selected** column.\n-    - To add a whole category, select a category.\n-    - To add individual items from a category, select the down arrow on the left of the category name, and then select individual items.\n-1. Select **Next**.\n-\n-1. On the **Preview** page, review:\n-    - The list of selected **Actions**.\n-    - The **YAML** or **Script** to confirm it's what you want.\n-1. If your controller isn't enabled, select **Download YAML** or **Download Script** to download the code and run it yourself.\n-1. Select **Submit**.\n-    A message confirms that your role has been submitted for creation\n-\n-1. The [**Permissions Management Tasks**](ui-tasks.md) pane appears on the right.\n-\n-    - The **Active** tab displays a list of the policies Permissions Management is currently processing.\n-    - The **Completed** tab displays a list of the policies Permissions Management has completed.\n-1. Once data collection for the specified authorization system is complete, the newly created role information is reflected.\n-\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- For information on how to view existing roles/policies, requests, and permissions, see [View roles/policies, requests, and permission in the Remediation dashboard](ui-remediation.md).\n-- For information on how to modify a role/policy, see [Modify a role/policy](how-to-modify-role-policy.md).\n-"
  },
  {
    "sha": "0a8c781c0cd7fec62a1e77b59e096f958225e4a8",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/how-to-create-rule.md",
    "status": "removed",
    "additions": 0,
    "deletions": 68,
    "changes": 68,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-create-rule.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-create-rule.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-create-rule.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,68 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Create a rule in the Autopilot dashboard in Permissions Management\n-description: How to create a rule in the Autopilot dashboard in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-# Create a rule in the Autopilot dashboard\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-This article describes how to create a rule in the Permissions Management **Autopilot** dashboard.\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Only users with **Administrator** permissions can view and make changes on the Autopilot tab. If you don't have these permissions, contact your system administrator.\n-\n-## Create a rule\n-\n-1. In the Permissions Management home page, select the **Autopilot** tab.\n-1. In the **Autopilot** dashboard, from the **Authorization system types** dropdown, select Amazon Web Services (**AWS**), Microsoft **Azure**, or Google Cloud Platform (**GCP**).\n-1. From the **Authorization System** dropdown, in the **List** and **Folders** box, select the account and folder names that you want, and then select **Apply**.\n-1. In the **Autopilot** dashboard, select **New Rule**.\n-1. In the **Rule Name** box, enter a name for your rule.\n-1. Select **AWS**, **Azure**, **GCP**, and then select **Next**.\n-\n-1. Select **Authorization Systems**, and then select **All** or the account names that you want.\n-1. From the **Folders** dropdown, select a folder, and then select **Apply**.\n-\n-    To change your folder settings, select **Reset**.\n-\n-    - The **Status** column displays if the authorization system is **Online** or **Offline**.\n-    - The **Controller** column displays if the controller is **Enabled** or **Not Enabled**.\n-\n-\n-1. Select **Configure** , and then select the following parameters for your rule:\n-\n-    - **Role Created On Is**: Select the duration in days.\n-    - **Role Last Used On Is**: Select the duration in days when the role was last used.\n-    - **Cross Account Role**: Select **True** or **False**.\n-\n-1. Select **Mode**, and then, if you want recommendations to be generated and applied manually, select **On-Demand**.\n-1. Select **Save**\n-\n-    The following information displays in the **Autopilot Rules** table:\n-\n-    - **Rule Name**: The name of the rule.\n-    - **State**: The status of the rule: idle (not being use) or active (being used).\n-    - **Rule Type**: The type of rule being applied.\n-    - **Mode**: The status of the mode: on-demand or not.\n-    - **Last Generated**: The date and time the rule was last generated.\n-    - **Created By**: The email address of the user who created the rule.\n-    - **Last Modified On**: The date and time the rule was last modified.\n-    - **Subscription**: Provides an **On** or **Off** switch that allows you to receive email notifications when recommendations have been generated, applied, or unapplied.\n-\n-\n-\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- For more information about viewing rules, see [View roles in the Autopilot dashboard](ui-autopilot.md).\n-- For information about generating, viewing, and applying rule recommendations for rules, see [Generate, view, and apply rule recommendations for rules](how-to-recommendations-rule.md).\n-- For information about notification settings for rules, see [View notification settings for a rule](how-to-notifications-rule.md)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "ce797bb4c6710963b0fc0c0068a06521ba147a11",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/how-to-delete-role-policy.md",
    "status": "removed",
    "additions": 0,
    "deletions": 40,
    "changes": 40,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-delete-role-policy.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-delete-role-policy.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-delete-role-policy.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,40 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Delete a role/policy in the Remediation dashboard in Permissions Management\n-description: How to delete a role/policy in the Microsoft Entra Permissions Management Remediation dashboard.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-# Delete a role/policy in the Remediation dashboard\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-This article describes how you can use the **Remediation** dashboard in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management to delete roles/policies for the Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, or Google Cloud Platform (GCP) authorization systems.\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> To view the **Remediation** dashboard, you must have **Viewer**, **Controller**, or **Administrator** permissions. To make changes on this tab, you must have **Controller** or **Administrator** permissions. If you don't have these permissions, contact your system administrator.\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Microsoft Azure uses the term *role* for what other Cloud providers call *policy*. Permissions Management automatically makes this terminology change when you select the authorization system type. In the user documentation, we use *role/policy* to refer to both.\n-\n-## Delete a role/policy\n-\n-1. On the Permissions Management home page, select the **Remediation** tab, and then select the **Role/Policies** subtab.\n-1. Select the role/policy you want to delete, and from the **Actions** column, select **Delete**.\n-\n-    You can only delete a role/policy if it isn't assigned to an identity.\n-\n-    You can't delete system roles/policies.\n-\n-1. On the **Preview** page, review the role/policy information to make sure you want to delete it, and then select **Submit**.\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-\n-- To view existing roles/policies, requests, and permissions, see [View roles/policies, requests, and permission in the Remediation dashboard](ui-remediation.md)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "9c631d1b9c51849f01069395a01abee76f060ffc",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/how-to-modify-role-policy.md",
    "status": "removed",
    "additions": 0,
    "deletions": 40,
    "changes": 40,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-modify-role-policy.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-modify-role-policy.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-modify-role-policy.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,40 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Modify a role/policy in the Remediation dashboard in Permissions Management\n-description: How to modify a role/policy in the Remediation dashboard in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-# Modify a role/policy in the Remediation dashboard\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-This article describes how you can use the **Remediation** dashboard in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management to modify roles/policies for the Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, or Google Cloud Platform (GCP) authorization systems.\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> To view the **Remediation** tab, you must have **Viewer**, **Controller**, or **Administrator** permissions. To make changes on this tab, you must have **Controller** or **Administrator** permissions. If you don't have these permissions, contact your system administrator.\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Microsoft Azure uses the term *role* for what other cloud providers call *policy*. Permissions Management automatically makes this terminology change when you select the authorization system type. In the user documentation, we use *role/policy* to refer to both.\n-\n-## Modify a role/policy\n-\n-1. On the Permissions Management home page, select the **Remediation** tab, and then select the **Role/Policies** tab.\n-1. Select the role/policy you want to modify, and from the **Actions** column, select **Modify**.\n-\n-     You can't modify **System** policies and roles.\n-\n-1. On the **Statements** page, make your changes to the **Tasks**, **Resources**, **Request conditions**, and **Effect** sections as required, and then select **Next**.\n-\n-1. Review the changes to the JSON or script on the **Preview** page, and then select **Submit**.\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- For information on how to view existing roles/policies, requests, and permissions, see [View roles/policies, requests, and permission in the Remediation dashboard](ui-remediation.md).\n-- To view information about roles/policies, see [View information about roles/policies](how-to-view-role-policy.md).\n\\ No newline at end of file"
  },
  {
    "sha": "9940c0a4ae9332dfc4c33ce952b59335951ee572",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/how-to-offboard-permissions-management.md",
    "status": "removed",
    "additions": 0,
    "deletions": 126,
    "changes": 126,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-offboard-permissions-management.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-offboard-permissions-management.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-offboard-permissions-management.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,126 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Microsoft Entra Permissions Management offboarding guidance\n-description: How to transition off of Microsoft Entra Permissions Management for the anticipated product deprecation.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/03/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-# How to offboard and transition off of Microsoft Entra Permissions Management \n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire). \n-\n-Microsoft Entra Permissions Management (Permissions Management) is retiring on October 01, 2025, with new purchases unavailable starting April 1, 2025. Existing paid customers will continue to have access to Permissions Management between April 1, 2025 - September 30, 2025. \n-\n-On October 01, 2025, Permissions Management will be automatically offboarded and associated data collection will be deleted. For customers needing to offboard before October 1, 2025, refer to the [Offboarding steps](#offboarding-steps) section in this guide. \n-\n-## Why is Permissions Management being retired? \n-\n-The decision to phase out Microsoft Entra Permissions Management from the Microsoft Security portfolio was made after deep consideration of our innovation portfolio and how we can focus on delivering the best innovations aligned to our differentiating areas and partners with the ecosystem on adjacencies. We remain committed to delivering top-tier solutions across the Microsoft Entra portfolio, which includes Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Entra Suite (encompassing ID Protection, ID Governance, Verified ID, Internet Access, and Private Access), Microsoft Entra External ID, Microsoft Entra Workload ID, and more.\n-\n-\n-## Recommended solutions\n-\n-Since Permissions Management is retiring, Microsoft recommends that customers who have onboarded the product in their environment start planning for transition. Customers who are not onboarded should refrain from onboarding.   \n-\n-To support this transition, Microsoft is partnering with [Delinea](https://delinea.com/). Delinea offers a cloud-native, fully Microsoft-compatible Cloud Infrastructure Entitlement Management (CIEM) solution, Privilege Control for Cloud Entitlements (PCCE). PCCE provides functionality comparable to Permissions Management, including continuous discovery of entitlements that allow you to monitor and adjust access rights for both human and machine identities.  \n-\n-We recommend beginning the shift away from Permissions Management as soon as possible, well before September 30th.
